reviewText: Almost 1000 years ago, Ocmulgee became one of the first alrge ceremonial centers of an ancient civilization. Compulsive builders, The Mississippians constructed great cities and thousands of mounds. For hundreds of years they dominated almost half of ancient America. Deep within Ocmulgee's smoke-filled earthlodge, chiefs, council members and ceremonial leaders sat around a central fire: an eagle effigy moded into the earthen floor at their feet. What happened her 1000 years ago? Discover the surprising answers, the art and trade networks of the Mississippians and mysteries of the Mounds.
